chunks.original_text: 昊元年丁未二月初八日 命选精道法师赴阙书 昊王书致玄坛教主龙虎山张天师。 予近自正月为国家之事，心所欠者，欲奏闻上帝。 奈无人捧词，至于天庭，故差人诣天师门下。 望天师以彼祖宗之灵，必当诚心，差精通道妙之师，捧词达天，以申祈祷之情，即师之虔意也。 书至，幸望令能者之师前来，再不多叔。 本年五月 洪武元年，上登大宝位，锡宴于便殿。 上顾谕曰：兹授卿以大真人称号，址阁命将议给食禄。 既而面可辞俸之奏，俾专出符录如故事，恩免通户及大上清宫各色摇役，永为定例。 命给银印，视正二品，设赞教掌书佐理等官。 授四十二代天师大真人诰 奉天承运，皇帝制曰：朕惟玄教真风，阐五千余言之典。 祖庭积庆，衍四十二代之传。 地灵毓龙虎之英，仙骨炼鹤鸾之表，掌兹正一品，佑我大明。 天师张正常简素性，成端凝，天赋琳书宝札。 探秘妙於珠黍之中，绿舆琼轮，超冥漠於游霄之上。 仗剑则鬼神听令，登坛则雷雨应时。 卓尔天人之师，允矣神明之冑。 然道德不拘於名爵，性情贵守於中和。 夫何近代以来，特授官资之显，揆以至理，未足为荣。 用制真人之美称，俾冠道流於当世，声扬寰宇，法主宗坛。 予欲通诚於九天，汝则以精神而运用。 予欲敷治於四海，汝则以清静而辅毗。 茂膺笼元，永绥福履。 可授正一教主嗣汉四十二代天师护国阐祖通诚崇道弘德大真人领道教事宜令张正常。 准此。 制诰
chunks.translated_text:
On the eighth day of the second month in the Dingwei year of the Haonian era, a decree was issued to select a master of refined Daoist arts to present a missive at court. The King of Hao penned a letter to the Master of the Mysterious Altar, Celestial Master Zhang of Mount Longhu.

Recently, since the first month, We have been preoccupied with matters of state, yet what weighs upon Our heart is the desire to memorialize the Supreme Emperor. However, with no one to bear the petition to the Celestial Court, We have dispatched an envoy to the Celestial Master’s gate. We trust that, by the numinous power of your ancestors, you will surely act with utmost sincerity, sending a master well-versed in the wondrous arts of the Dao to bear the petition to Heaven, thereby expressing Our prayers. This would indeed reflect your reverent intent. Upon receipt of this letter, We hope you will promptly send forth a capable master. No further elaboration is needed.

In the fifth month of the first year of the Hongwu era, upon ascending the imperial throne, the Emperor held a banquet in the side hall. Turning to address the assembly, the Emperor proclaimed: “We hereby bestow upon you the title of Grand Perfected. The Ministry of Rites shall deliberate and grant you an official stipend.” The Celestial Master then respectfully declined the salary, requesting instead to continue issuing talismans and registers as before. In recognition of this, the Emperor exempted all households under his jurisdiction, as well as the various corvée services of the Great Shangqing Palace, establishing this as a permanent precedent. A silver seal was conferred, ranking him equivalent to a principal second-grade official, with the appointment of assistant instructors, scribes, and administrative aides.

**Imperial Edict Conferring the Title of Grand Perfected upon the Forty-Second Generation Celestial Master**

By the Mandate of Heaven, the Emperor decrees:

We reflect upon the true essence of the Mysterious Teachings, which expounds the canon of over five thousand words. The ancestral sanctuary has accumulated blessings, transmitting its lineage through forty-two generations. The land’s numen has nurtured the dragon-tiger’s elite, and the immortal’s bones have been refined into the semblance of crane and phoenix. You preside over the Orthodox Unity teachings, aiding Our Great Ming.

Celestial Master Zhang Zhengchang, of simple and upright nature, embodies steadfast integrity. Heaven has endowed him with the sacred scriptures and precious talismans. He delves into the profound mysteries amid the pearls and grains, riding jade palanquins and jasper wheels to transcend the void and soar above the clouds. With sword in hand, ghosts and spirits obey his commands; ascending the altar, thunder and rain respond to his call. Truly, he is a master of both Heaven and humanity, a scion of divine luminosity.

Yet virtue is not constrained by titles and ranks, and temperament prizes the cultivation of harmony. In recent times, the conferral of eminent official positions, though seemingly honorable, does not align with the highest principles. Thus, We bestow the noble title of Grand Perfected, elevating him above all Daoist adepts of the age, his name resounding across the realm as the master of the ancestral altar.

We seek to convey Our sincerity to the Nine Heavens, and you shall employ your spiritual power to fulfill this. We aim to govern the Four Seas, and you shall aid this with your purity and tranquility. May you abundantly receive the primal qi, eternally securing blessings and prosperity.

Let it be decreed: Zhang Zhengchang, Master of Orthodox Unity, Forty-Second Generation Celestial Master, Protector of the State, Propagator of the Ancestral Teachings, Communicator of Sincerity, Venerator of the Dao, and Magnifier of Virtue, Grand Perfected in Charge of Daoist Affairs, is hereby invested with this title.

So ordered.

chunks.original_text: 洪武元年三月初一日 之宝 准辞还山上御谨身殿，从容谓曰：卿乃祖天师，有功於国，所以家世与孔子并传，以迄于今。 卿宜体之以清静无为，辅予至治，则予汝嘉。 谕毕，出白金十五镒赐之，俾茸府弟。 二年二月 特召入朝，上御奉天殿赐见，预命设安待之，是月垂顾问者四。 二月十三日，上将通诚於天帝，致斋三日。 御衰冕，亲署御名于重，劫太常设乐，手授俾祝而焚之。 礼成，赐金币，宴于文楼，群弟子飨於别馆，赏责有差。 三年六月 上录功她宠，特劝吏部，改赠正常父三十九代天师太玄辅化体仁应道大真人，嗣成为正一教主，大玄弘化明诚崇道大真人。 改封正常母明慧慈顺仙姑胡氏，为恭顺慈惠淑静玄君b 上一日召见，问以鬼神情状，命更给掌天下道教银印。 五年 加授永掌道教事诰
chunks.translated_text:
On the first day of the third month in the first year of Hongwu, the Imperial Seal was affixed. The Emperor, retiring to the Hall of Reverent Self-Cultivation, addressed him with ease: "Your ancestor, the Celestial Master, rendered meritorious service to the state, and thus your lineage has been transmitted alongside that of Confucius, enduring to this day. You should embody the principles of purity, tranquility, and non-action to assist in Our governance of utmost order, and We shall bestow Our favor upon you." Upon concluding the edict, he presented fifteen *yi* of silver to fund repairs for the Celestial Master’s residence.

In the second month of the second year, the Celestial Master was specially summoned to court. The Emperor, seated in the Hall of Heavenly Favor, granted him an audience and had accommodations prepared in advance. That month, he was summoned for consultation four times. On the thirteenth day of the second month, as the Emperor prepared to convey sincerity to the Heavenly Emperor, he observed a three-day fast. Clad in imperial robes and crown, he personally inscribed his name upon the ritual document. The Court of Imperial Sacrifices arranged the music, and he handed the document to the Celestial Master to recite and burn. Upon completion of the rites, he bestowed gold and silk, hosted a banquet at the Hall of Literary Glory, and provided a separate feast for his disciples at another pavilion, with rewards distributed according to rank.

In the sixth month of the third year, the Emperor, recognizing his merits and bestowing favor, specially instructed the Ministry of Rites to posthumously confer upon Zhengchang’s father, the Thirty-Ninth Generation Celestial Master, the title *Grand Perfected of Great Mystery, Assistant to Transformation, Embodying Benevolence, Responding to the Dao*. His successor was invested as *Master of Orthodox Unity, Grand Perfected of Great Mystery, Propagator of Transformation, Clarifier of Sincerity, Venerator of the Dao*. Zhengchang’s mother, the Immortal Lady Hu, formerly *Minghui Cishun*, was re-enfeoffed as *Reverent, Compassionate, Kind, Serene, and Mysterious Lady*.

One day, the Emperor summoned him for an audience and inquired about the nature of spirits and deities, then ordered the issuance of a silver seal for overseeing all Daoist affairs throughout the realm. In the fifth year, he further conferred the edict *Perpetually Entrusted with Daoist Affairs*.

chunks.original_text: 奉天承运，皇帝制曰：朕惟道家者流，本於清静无为，其来尚矣。 龙虎山张氏，自汉以下，宗派相继。 其四十二代孙正常，存心冲澹，葆德纯和，远绍宗传，以守正一。 朕用嘉之，是宜锡以真人之号，尔其益振玄风，永掌其教焉。 ．可授正一嗣教护国阐祖通诚崇道弘德大真人，掌天下道教事。 宜令张正常准此。 制诰 洪武五年十二月日 之宝 九年 上遣使召，忽先期入见，上喜曰：卿来何，与朕意相符。 明年秋，朕将遣使，祠海岳诸神。 卿当妙柬清修之士，与其偕来。 赐宴，及金纹法衣、玉圭佩、法器之属。 十年 命率弟子至京，上召见。
chunks.translated_text:
By the Mandate of Heaven, the Emperor decrees:

We reflect that the Daoist tradition, rooted in purity, stillness, and non-action, has endured since ancient times. The Zhang lineage of Mount Longhu has maintained its ancestral transmission without interruption since the Han dynasty. Its forty-second generation descendant, Zhengchang, embodies a mind of profound tranquility and preserves virtue in its purest harmony. Faithfully upholding the Orthodox Unity tradition, he has carried forward the ancestral teachings. We commend his merit and deem it fitting to bestow upon him the title of *Perfected*. Let him further invigorate the mystic winds of the Dao and perpetually oversee its teachings.

Thus, he is hereby invested as *Successor of Orthodox Unity, Protector of the Realm, Expounder of the Ancestral Teachings, Communicator of Sincerity, Venerator of the Dao, and Grand Perfected of Great Virtue*, with authority over all Daoist affairs throughout the realm. Let Zhang Zhengchang act in accordance with this decree.

*Edict*
Seal of the fifth year of Hongwu, twelfth month

In the ninth year, the Emperor dispatched an envoy to summon him, but Zhengchang arrived ahead of schedule for an audience. The Emperor rejoiced, saying, “Your coming aligns perfectly with Our intent.” The following autumn, We shall send envoys to offer sacrifices to the gods of the seas and mountains. You shall select refined practitioners of pure cultivation to accompany them.

A banquet was granted, along with gifts of a gold-threaded ritual robe, a jade gui tablet and pendant, and ritual implements.

In the tenth year, he was commanded to lead his disciples to the capital, where the Emperor summoned him for an audience.

chunks.original_text: 锡宴午门之城楼，上举爵谓曰：卿宜罄此一觞。 劫内侍官出御制历代天师赞示曰：他日当书以赐卿。 明日，韶偕太师韩国公李善长代祠嵩山，分遣大臣与弟子代祠群望，仍赐衣二袭，及褚币有差。 既还复，命锡宴，赏如初。 遣祠嵩山敕 勅正一嗣教大真人张正常，朕闻天生民而立君，君为民而立命。 所以谨百神之祀，乃国之先务也。 朕与卿等当群雄角遂之时，战胜攻取，非上天后土之眷命，岳镇海渍之效灵，安能如是。 今者新秋在迩，岳镇海渍之杞，礼当报谢。 古者君狩方隅，诣祠而祭。 朕为新造邦基，民生方始，未获亲往。 特命卿等代朕以行，奉牺牲祝帛於神所。 故兹劫谕汝往，钦哉。 勑　命
chunks.translated_text:
At the Wumen Gate tower, a banquet was bestowed. The Emperor raised his goblet and said, “You should drain this cup.” He then commanded the eunuch attendants to present an imperial composition, *Eulogies on the Heavenly Masters Through the Ages*, saying, “One day, I shall inscribe this and grant it to you.” The following day, an imperial edict was issued for Zhengchang to accompany the Grand Preceptor, Duke of Han, Li Shanchang, in offering sacrifices at Mount Song. Other high ministers were dispatched with his disciples to perform rites at the sacred peaks and altars. Robes in two sets were conferred, along with varying amounts of silk and coin.

Upon their return, another banquet was granted, with rewards as before.

*Edict for the Sacrificial Mission to Mount Song*
We decree unto Zhang Zhengchang, the Great Perfected One who Inherits and Propagates the Orthodox Unity Teachings:

We have heard that Heaven brings forth the people and establishes a ruler, and the ruler, for the people, establishes the Mandate. Thus, the reverent worship of the hundred spirits is the foremost duty of the state. When We and you contended amidst the strife of rival warlords, our victories in battle and conquest could not have been achieved without the favor of the Supreme August One and the Earth God, nor without the efficacious numen of the sacred peaks and sea marshes. Now, as the new autumn approaches, the rites for the sacred peaks and sea marshes must be performed to offer thanks and repayment.

In ancient times, the sovereign would personally journey to the four quarters to perform sacrifices at the altars. Yet We, having newly established the foundations of the state, find the people’s livelihood only just begun, and thus cannot attend in person. We therefore specially command you to act as Our proxy, presenting sacrificial animals, libations, and silk offerings at the abodes of the gods.

Hence this decree is issued for your compliance. Hold it in reverence. By Our Mandate.

chunks.original_text: 洪武十年六月日 之　宝 十一年 上闻礼部尚书张筹代奏讣音天衷嗟悼良久，且曰：朕欲命其褊祠五岳，今方一至嵩山，何期大数止於此。 遂亲制祭文一通，诏遣前浙江行省参知. 政事安庆诣山谕祭。 维洪武十一年，岁在戊午正月甲戌朔越二十日癸巳，皇帝遣浙江参政安庆，致祭于大真人张正常之灵曰：继出世法，统仙度人，御灾捍患，机斡万灵。 飞符仗剑，转斗移星。 雷神听令，妖魅潜形。 道光斯着，貌正精英。 何乘鸾之去急，控法印於上清。 今遣人祀以牲醴，尔其有知，尚飨。 皇明恩命世录卷之二竟 #1：『代』 原作『伐』，据上下文义改。 #2：『莱』 原文不清，疑是。 皇明恩命世录卷之三 四十三代大真人张宇初
chunks.translated_text:
The Eleventh Day of the Sixth Month, Hongwu Reign Year 10 [Seal]

In the eleventh year, the Ministry of Rites, led by Minister Zhang Chou, presented the report of a passing. Upon hearing the news, the Emperor sighed in sorrow for a long while, saying: "I had intended to command the establishment of separate shrines for the Five Peaks, but he had only just reached Mount Song when his allotted span came to this end." Thereupon, the Emperor personally composed a eulogy and issued a decree dispatching An Qing, former Vice Minister of the Zhejiang Branch Secretariat, to the mountain to convey the imperial sacrifice.

In the eleventh year of the Hongwu reign, the year *wuwu*, on the twentieth day of the first month, *guisi* (the first day being *jiayin*), the Emperor dispatched An Qing, Vice Minister of Zhejiang, to offer sacrifices to the spirit of the Great Perfected Zhang Zhengchang, saying:

Successor to the world-transcending Dharma,
Unifier of the immortals and savior of humanity,
Warder against calamity and defender from harm,
Master of the mechanisms that turn the myriad spirits—
With flying talismans and sword in hand,
You shifted constellations and moved stars.
The thunder gods heeded your commands,
While demons and specters hid their forms.
The radiance of the Dao shone forth,
Your countenance upright, your essence refined.
Why did your phoenix-borne departure come so swiftly,
Taking the Dharma Seal to the Supreme Clarity?
Now We send one to offer sacrifices of animals and wine—
If you possess awareness, partake in this offering.

*Huangming Enming Shilu*, Scroll Two (End)

[Note 2: The character *lai* (莱) is unclear in the original; the reading is conjectural.]

In the thirteenth year of Hongwu, an imperial edict was conferred upon the Great Perfected:

By the Mandate of Heaven and the Grace of the Emperor, We decree:

We have heard that the rulers of high antiquity governed the realm by dividing the people into four classes—scholars, farmers, artisans, and merchants. Yet from the Han dynasty to the present, the people have been guided by six, with the addition of the Buddhist and Daoist traditions.

The Dao has flourished because of your ancestor, Yuchu, who communed with spirits and mastered transformations, ascending in wondrous flight into the Great Void. He braved the boundless winds of the vast expanse and inhaled the vast qi of the cosmos. Through this, he brought benefit to the multitudes, and his merits were recorded through the ages. Thus, the Dharma has been transmitted for generations, and the lamp of incense has burned without end. This is because his vows were profound, his virtue spread above and below, and his spirit grew ever more efficacious.

Now that the former Perfected has departed, you □ shall succeed in this generation. We specially dispatch an envoy to your residence to appoint you as the Great Perfected of the Orthodox Unity Tradition, Successor to the Teachings, Unifier of the Dao, Expounder of Non-Action, Illuminator of Ancestral Glory, and Administrator of Daoist Affairs. Conduct yourself with reverence and care. By Our decree.

*Edict*
The twenty-eighth day of the second month, the thirteenth year of Hongwu.

**Edict Conferring the Title of Mysterious Lady upon Madam Bao**

By the Mandate of Heaven, the Emperor decrees:

Among ministers who hold rank and office, wives derive honor from their husbands, and mothers rise in esteem through their sons—such has been the virtuous precedent from ancient times to the present.

You, Madam Bao, mother of Zhang Yuchu, the Orthodox Unity Successor and Perfected Master, have given birth to a worthy son who has worthily carried forth the Mysterious Tradition. By special decree, you are hereby enfeoffed as the **Mysterious Lady of Pure Emptiness, Primal Simplicity, and Wondrous Virtue**.

Let you ever hold this in reverence, and thus uphold the grace of this imperial mandate.

**Decree and Edict**
*Twenty-first day of the first lunar month, the fourteenth year of Hongwu*

*Sixteenth year:* Summoned to the capital; commanded to preside over the **Great Jade Register Ritual** at Mount Zijin.

*Eighteenth year:* Commanded to perform the **Rain-Praying Rite** at the Divine Music Abbey.

*Twenty-third year:* Specially ordered to oversee the reconstruction of the **Supreme Clarity Palace**.

*Twenty-fourth year, sixth day of the sixth lunar month:*
**Prohibition Against Unauthorized Issuance of Talismans and Edicts**
The Ministry of Rites respectfully transmits the imperial decree: In Jiangxi, Zhejiang, Fujian, and other regions, many falsely invoke the name of Perfected Master Zhang to privately issue talismans and edicts, deluding the people and extorting wealth. Henceforth, any who violate this decree shall be beheaded and their bodies displayed, their families exiled beyond the frontier. *Respect this.*

*Eighth lunar month:* Granted the **Seal of the Orthodox Unity Mysterious Altar of Mount Dragon-Tiger**, to safeguard the sacred mountain and regulate the issuance of talismans.

*Thirty-fifth year:* Bestowed funds for the renovation of the **Supreme Clarity Palace**.

chunks.original_text: 永乐元年，命陪祀天坛。 四年 命编进道书敕 勑真人张宇初，前者命尔编修道教书，可早完进来，通类刊版。 故勑。 广　运 永乐四年十一月十九日 之　宝 五年 命建斋有应奖敕 勑正一嗣教真人张宇初：朕惟玄元之教，统大道之宗，阖辟阴阳，斡运神化，混融三界，总摄万灵。 行其道者，非精诚之至，曷能感通比者。 仁孝皇后崩逝，特命尔率诸道众，爰举荐扬，启玉录之斋科，宣琅函之秘典。 百日之内，瑞应骈臻。 灿五色之庆云，烂九天之瑞霭。 青鸾缭绕於琳馆，白鹤飞舞於瑶坛。 五色祥光，通明彻夜。 斯皆由尔法承先祖，道契至真。 探玄牝之微，赞虚无之化。 克遵朕命，以展纯诚。 暨诸道众修持善行，葆练精和，执恪秉虔，辅勤昭事。 其中亦有至人，道化高妙，出显入微，灵变不测。 感朕诚心，来临法会，证盟善功。 朕德薄所未能知者，藉兹众善。 是以上玄响答，茂集嘉祯。 睹兹感应之彰明，允想神灵之获庆。 超登大梵，永遂逍遥。 式副朕怀，特申嘉奖。 尔其益懋神功，愈致精一。 洞明妙化，浑合无为。 弘阐宗风，翼我皇度。 钦哉，故勑。 广　运
chunks.translated_text:
**First Year of Yongle:** Commanded to participate in the sacrifices at the Altar of Heaven.

**Fourth Year:** Commanded to compile and submit Daoist texts.

Previously, you were ordered to compile Daoist scriptures. Complete this task promptly and submit them for comprehensive block-printing.
*By the Imperial Seal.*
*Broad and Everlasting.*
*Nineteenth day of the eleventh lunar month, fourth year of Yongle.*

**Fifth Year:** Commanded to conduct a ritual fast; rewarded with an edict.
*Edict to Zhang Yu Chu, Perfected Master and Successor of the Orthodox Unity Tradition:*
We consider the teachings of the Mysterious Origin to govern the ancestral Dao, opening and closing yin and yang, revolving the divine transformations, harmonizing the Three Realms, and embracing the myriad spirits. Those who practice this Way must attain utmost sincerity to achieve resonance.

Upon the passing of the Empress Renxiao, We specially commanded you to lead the Daoist assembly in conducting the *Yulu* ritual fast and reciting the secret classics from the jade caskets. Within a hundred days, auspicious responses converged: radiant five-colored clouds of blessing, resplendent nine-heavenly mists of fortune. Azure simurghs circled the jade halls, white cranes danced above the alabaster altars. Five-colored auspicious lights shone brightly through the night.

All this arose from your inheritance of the ancestral Dharma, your resonance with the utmost Perfection, your exploration of the subtleties of the Mysterious Female, and your assistance in the transformations of Emptiness and Non-Being. You have faithfully followed Our command, demonstrating pure sincerity. Moreover, the Daoist assembly cultivated virtuous conduct, preserving refinement and harmony, upholding reverence and devotion, and diligently serving the rites. Among them were also perfected beings of lofty Dao and wondrous transformation, manifesting the subtle and the evident, their spiritual transformations unfathomable. Moved by Our sincere heart, they attended the ritual assembly, bearing witness to the merit of goodness.

Our virtue is meager, and what We cannot comprehend is aided by this assembly of goodness. Thus, the response of the Supreme Mystery was resounding, and abundant auspicious signs gathered. Witnessing these manifest resonances, We are assured that the spirits have received blessing, transcending to the Great Brahmā, forever attaining carefree wandering. This fulfills Our aspirations, and We specially bestow commendation.

Henceforth, you must further exert your divine merit, ever more refining your essence and unity. Penetrate the wondrous transformations, merging with Non-Action. Vastly propagate the ancestral teachings, assisting Our imperial governance.
*Respect this.*
*By the Imperial Seal.*
*Broad and Everlasting.*

You glorified your ancestral tradition, upholding the principles of the Mysterious School. Above, you subtly assisted the imperial order; below, you delivered and uplifted the multitudes. We had hoped you would forever aid in the great felicity—how could you so suddenly ascend as an immortal? Thus, We specially send this messenger to offer sacrifices, to express Our sentiments. To the Grand Perfected of the Orthodox Unity Tradition, Successor of the Teaching, Zhang Yuqing:

You dispatched the Daoist Wang Youlai to present a memorial, whereupon We showed him the *Lingying Yuan'guang Tu* (Numinous Response and Radiant Light Chart). Yet he, being one unversed in the Dao, gazed upon it in silent bewilderment, unable to utter a word. Before even finishing one or two pages, he sought to depart—his heart truly held no faith. Henceforth, when dispatching envoys, you must select only those who revere and honor the foundational teachings of the Dao. Thus may the Mysterious Gate be glorified and the Daoist lineage be enriched.

By this edict.

*Seal affixed on the fourth day of the seventh month in the eleventh year of Yongle, under the reign title "Vast Fortune."*

---

A further edict is hereby issued, granting the *Taihe Yuan'guang Tu* (Chart of Supreme Harmony and Radiant Light) and the sacred *langmei* (wax apple):

To the Grand Perfected of the Orthodox Unity Tradition, Successor of the Teaching, Zhang Yuqing:

Mount Wudang, a renowned mountain under heaven, is the sacred site where the Perfected Warrior attained the Dao and where numinous responses and transformative influences manifest. At the end of the Yuan dynasty, its palaces and temples were all destroyed by war, leaving Daoist adepts and scholars of cultivation with no place to turn for refuge or reverence.

With sincerity in Our heart, We commanded the reconstruction of its palaces and temples. Above, this serves to honor the spirits of Our late father and mother in heaven; below, it seeks blessings for all living beings under heaven. The celestial perfected have been moved by this devotion, and numinous responses have repeatedly manifested. Radiant light illumines the heavens, and the *langmei* bears fruit. Your subordinates have reverently presented a painted chart and the *langmei* to offer in sacrifice to the ancestors. Now, to make manifest the divine efficacy, We specially dispatch an envoy to bestow upon you the sacred chart and one hundred *langmei* fruits. You shall receive them with reverence.

By this edict.

*Vast Fortune.*

To the Orthodox Unity Successor of the Teachings, Perfected Zhang Yuqing—Mount Wudang is a renowned mountain under heaven, the sacred site where the Perfected Warrior attained the Dao and where numinous responses and transformations manifest. Radiant light blazes forth, resplendent in five colors; the sacred images appear luminous within the light. Tens of thousands of observers have all marveled in awe. We have already bestowed names upon them: the Jade Void Palace of the Dark Heavens, the Purple Empyrean Palace of the Great Mystery, the Five Dragons Palace of Flourishing Sanctity, and the Great Sage Palace of the Southern Cliff.

Yet this renowned mountain and sublime site must have eminent persons and Daoist adepts to serve as abbots and guardians. For the Great Sage Palace of the Southern Cliff, We have already appointed Sun Biyun of the Right Orthodox Unity as abbot. For the remaining three sites, you shall select two individuals of virtuous conduct to serve as abbots for each. Additionally, choose devout, reverent, and meticulous Daoists—fifty for each site—to serve as guardians. If the number cannot be met at once, assign as many as you have selected to the four sites for guardianship. Let them cultivate with diligence and promote the flourishing of the Daoist teachings.

By this edict.

In the expansive reign of the eleventh year of Yongle, on the twenty-fifth day of the eighth month, under the imperial seal, an edict was issued in the ninth month dispatching envoys to the mountain to conduct a seven-day Golden Register Grand Offering at the Great Upper Clarity Palace. In the thirteenth year, an edict was issued to renovate the Great Upper Clarity Palace and construct the Zhenyi Abbey. Embankments were built, and a floating bridge was erected.

In the fifteenth year, the emperor commanded sacrifices to be offered at the Western Sacred Altar and ordered prayers at the Lingji Palace in Fujian for auspicious responses. An edict of commendation was bestowed upon Zhang Yuqing, the Orthodox Unity Lineage Successor and Perfected Master of the Daoist Teachings:

Within seven days, auspicious omens repeatedly manifested, and blessings converged in abundance. Auspicious clouds displayed their five-colored patterns, and sacred ribbons soared with the hues of the nine heavens. Divine numina revealed themselves in wondrous transformations. Azure luan birds and white cranes soared and danced in throngs. All this was due to the August Benevolence Perfected Lord’s bestowed efficacy and manifest numinosity, and also because you illuminated the ancestral model, your Dao resonating with the Supreme Perfected, thereby responding to the reverent solemnity of the rites.

Moreover, the August Benevolence Perfected Lord praised your diligent and sincere supplications, which were witnessed and delighted in by the Supreme Mystery. Without your reverent and meticulous devotion, how could such achievements have been attained? Now, We specially bestow this edict of commendation to express Our esteem. May you further flourish in your Daoist practice and invigorate the mystic winds. Expound and propagate the teachings of purity and emptiness, uphold and inherit the ancestral lineage of the Great Dao. Thereby, Our nation shall forever attain the utmost governance. Respect this mandate."

chunks.original_text: 永乐十九年　月　日 之　宝 二十二年 命醮于太和山 命建荐扬太斋瑞应奖敕 敕正一嗣教真人张宇清，朕惟上, 帝以好生为德，故玄元以惠济为教。 真体清静无为，其用神妙无方。 得其妙者，斯能见诸功用，盖上则有以阴斓皇度，下则有以福被幽明。 历代所纪，具有明征。 朕祇承天序，恭事上帝倦禅倦，夙夜仰惟皇考皇妣，圣灵在上，一及慕无极，劬劳大德。 欲报无由，敬遵道教，召天下道士，奉建荐扬大声。 尔能恪承朕命躬率道众，致其精处，阐扬宝范，用达朕之诚。 捆灵赐昭答，自初至于讫事，天宇澄明，凝寒之月，蕾买飓不作，和气冲融，瑞景式昭，福应斯集，固本于上帝与朕皇考皇妣之悦鉴，亦尔等敬用朕命，以克臻兹。 朕既嘉责之，仍赐劲奖谕，尚其益精尔道，益笃尔行，宣扬玄教，上以祈福宗社，下以普利生灵，汝其懋哉。 故勅。 勅　命

In the twenty-second year, an Offering Ritual was commanded at Mount Taihe; a Great Purification Fast for Auspicious Responses was established, and this rescript of reward was conferred.

To Zhang Yuqing, Perpetuating the Teachings of the Orthodox Unity, We reflect: the Supreme Emperor’s virtue lies in cherishing life, and thus the Mysterious Origin’s teachings center on benevolent salvation. The true essence is pure, tranquil, and non-action; its function is spiritually wondrous and boundless. Those who attain its mystery can manifest its works—above, subtly supporting the imperial order; below, extending blessings to all, seen and unseen. Records from past dynasties provide clear evidence of this.

We, reverently upholding Heaven’s mandate and diligently serving the Supreme Emperor, day and night reflect upon Our late imperial father and mother, whose sagely spirits abide above. Our longing knows no limit, and We recall their great toil and virtue. Unable to repay them, We respectfully follow the Daoist teachings, summoning Daoist masters from across the realm to conduct the Great Purification Fast for Auspicious Responses.

You have faithfully carried out Our command, personally leading the Daoist assembly to devote your utmost sincerity, expounding the treasury of teachings, and conveying Our sincerity. The divine response was luminous: from the ritual’s beginning to its conclusion, the heavens remained serene and bright. We commend and reward you, and further issue this rescript of encouragement. Strive ever more to refine your Dao, deepen your conduct, and propagate the Mysterious Teachings—above, to pray for the fortune of the imperial ancestral temple, and below, to universally benefit all living beings. Let this be your earnest endeavor.

By this rescript, so commanded.

chunks.original_text: 永乐二十二年月日 之　宝 宣德元年 召见，锡宴内殿。 推恩申锡嘉号敕 勑正一嗣教大真人张宇清，朕惟玄元之道，先天地，不见其始，后天地，不见其终，根柢群品，神妙万化。 然其本体，至清静无为，故历代崇奖用弘清静之治焉。 我国家重道德之教，尔父尔兄，咸克祗事。 既尔嗣厥职，皇祖太宗皇帝锡之以美号，宠之以厚恩，至矣。 尔克笃诚敬，用不忝荣命，十有余年。 继事皇考仁宗昭皇帝，亦克恭慎。 朕惟祖宗之所重也，达孝推恩，用申锡尔嘉号日：正一嗣教清虚冲素光祖演道崇谦守静洞玄大真人，掌天下道教事。 夫静者，道之本，谦者，德之柄。 澹以处静，恭以履谦，静斯安，安斯一。 谦斯虚，虚斯明。 简约而息外骛，笃实而有光辉，务玄之道，孰切于尚其只服，丕衍宗风，懋之哉。 故勅。 谕祭曰：惟尔崇修玄素，志慕清虚，彻法录之科，探清微之旨，阐道范，光振宗风。 祇事先朝，累效勤恳。 朕钻承大统，申锡嘉，称方期，沥乃精诚导迎，景既告归。 几日，奄忽长终。 讣音来闻，良用悼叹。 兹特遣人赐尔祭葬，灵爽不昧，庶其飨之。 皇明恩命世录卷之四竟 皇明恩命世录卷之五
chunks.translated_text:
On a day in the twenty-second year of the Yongle reign, under the imperial seal, and in the first year of the Xuande reign, [the recipient] was summoned for an audience and granted a banquet in the inner palace.

By decree, extending grace and bestowing an honorific title:

To Zhang Yuqing, the Great Perfected of Orthodox Unity, Successor to the Teaching, We reflect: the Dao of the Mysterious Origin precedes heaven and earth, its beginning unseen; it follows heaven and earth, its end unseen. It is the root of all beings and the wondrous pivot of the myriad transformations. Yet its fundamental nature is utterly pure, still, and non-action. Thus, successive dynasties have honored and rewarded it to propagate governance through purity and stillness.

Our dynasty reveres the teaching of virtue and power. Your father and elder brother both served with reverence. Having succeeded to their office, Our imperial ancestor, the Emperor Taizong, bestowed upon you a noble title and favored you with profound grace—this was the utmost. You have upheld sincerity and reverence, not dishonoring the honor of your mandate, for over a decade. In serving Our late imperial father, the Emperor Renzong, you likewise fulfilled your duties with reverence and care.

Considering what Our ancestors valued, We extend filial grace and bestow upon you this honorific title: *Great Perfected of Orthodox Unity, Successor to the Teaching, Pure Emptiness and Tranquil Simplicity, Radiant Ancestral Dao, Reverent Humility and Guarded Stillness, Master of the Profound Mystery*, charged with overseeing the affairs of the Daoist teachings throughout the realm.

Stillness is the root of the Dao; humility is the handle of virtue. Abide in tranquility with simplicity; tread humbly with reverence. In stillness, there is peace; in peace, there is unity. In humility, there is emptiness; in emptiness, there is clarity. Cast aside distractions and embrace simplicity; cultivate sincerity and radiance will follow. Of all the essentials in the pursuit of the Mysterious Dao, what could be more pressing than upholding these? May you greatly propagate the ancestral teachings—strive earnestly!

By this decree.

Decree for the sacrificial offering:

You have devotedly cultivated the Mysterious and Unadorned, aspiring to purity and emptiness. You have mastered the precepts of the ritual codes and delved into the subtleties of the Pure and Subtle. You have illuminated the model of the Dao and gloriously upheld the ancestral teachings. In serving the previous courts, you repeatedly demonstrated diligence and sincerity.

We, having inherited the great mandate, extended grace and bestowed honors, hoping for a long and flourishing era. Yet you, guiding with utmost sincerity, have now suddenly departed. The news of your passing reached Us, and We are deeply grieved. Thus, We specially dispatch envoys to bestow upon you these sacrificial and burial rites. May your spirit, undimmed, partake in these offerings.

*Concluding the fourth scroll of Imperial Ming Grace and Mandates*

Above, it harmonizes governance; below, it bestows beneficence upon the living. Since ancient times, it has been honored and encouraged.

You, Zhang Maocheng, have inherited from your forebears the cultivation of the Supreme Dao. Your grandfather and father both reverently upheld it. Now, as you succeed them, We specially appoint you as the Grand Perfected of Orthodox Unity, Successor to the Teaching, Cultivator of the Supreme Dao, Preserver of Simplicity, and Expounder of the Dharma, to oversee the affairs of the Daoist teachings.

Local Daoist officials and priests are permitted to read, recite, and extol its teachings. Above, it shall serve to pray for the nation’s blessings; below, to seek fortune for the people. Your ancestors were descendants of the divine and enlightened, and for generations, the rightful eldest heirs have succeeded one another in overseeing the Daoist teachings, a tradition of long standing. When you were orphaned in youth, your kinsmen and others sought to encroach and seize your position. Strive to embody Our profound intentions, devote yourself to the Mysterious Teachings, flourish the ancestral traditions, offer prayers for the state’s felicity, and supplicate blessings for the people, thereby fulfilling the court’s esteem and encouragement. **By Edict.**
**Guangyun**

chunks.translated_text:
**Seal of the Edict Conferring the Title of Mysterious Lady upon the Mother of Wu**

By the Mandate of Heaven, the Emperor proclaims:

We hold that the Supreme Dao is nameless, yet those who cultivate its Way command reverence. Lineage has its origins, and those who deepen its roots shall see grace extend to the Mystic Gate. Wu Qing Sun, ennobled by imperial favor, owes his distinction to his mother’s virtue. You, Lady Wu, mother of Zhang Xuanging, *Zhengyi Sijiao Baohe Yangsu Jizu Shoudao* Great Perfected Master, have long embodied gentle kindness and harmonious grace. Your merit lies in guiding your son to fulfillment, and thus you are fittingly honored with this august decree. We hereby confer upon you the title of *Zhishun Shujing Xuanjun*, Mysterious Lady of Devoted Compliance and Serene Virtue. Wear this abundant grace, and may your example forever illuminate the model of the inner chambers. Hold this in awe.

*By Proclamation.*
The twenty-first day of the twelfth month, the thirteenth year of Chenghua.

**Seal**

---

**Imperial Edict Banning the Forgery of Talismans and Divination Tallies**

The Emperor hereby admonishes all military, civilian, and persons of every rank:

We note that Longhu Mountain in Guixi County, Guangxin Prefecture, is the ancestral seat and teaching domain of the Zhang Perfected. Since ancient times, talismans and registers have been transmitted by their lineage to the people. During the Hongwu era, decrees were issued to prohibit forgery, lest deceivers mislead the populace and extort wealth. In the Yongle era, it was ordained that fish be purchased and released into the mountain’s rivers to nurture life, forbidding all from netting or angling. Yet of late, powerful and unscrupulous rogues have repeatedly forged talismans and stolen fish, defying the imperial prohibitions. Now, as the *Sijiao* Perfected Zhang Xuanging petitions for redress, We issue this stern decree:

Henceforth, should any military, civilian, or person of any rank dare to persist in obstinacy, forging talismans or stealing fish, local authorities shall apprehend and interrogate them. Should officials fail to enforce this, they shall be punished without exception.

*By Edict.*

Not a speck of dust has stained you, as you polish the three-foot ice-jade vessel of your being; all myriad cares have dissolved, as you clarify the serene moon of the nine heavens. You transcend the mundane to enter sageliness, taming tigers and subduing dragons. Among springs and rocks, you cultivate loftiness; with zither and books, you find delight. Beholding the wondrous Dao of emptiness and tranquility, you truly embody the radiant light of salvation.

Now, with fine robes of multicolored silk gathered about your knees and verdant trees filling your sight, you are fortunate that neither honor nor disgrace disturbs you. We long to behold your pure countenance and cherish distant thoughts of you. Moreover, your words carry weight, and your devotion is earnest—We trust you shall uphold this.

In the fifth month of this year, by imperial command, divine statues and bestowed seals were decreed. Eunuch Bao Zhong of the Directorate of Ceremonial, transmitting the sacred edict, ordered that the received statues of the Three Pure Ones, the Four Emperors, and the stellar deities be entrusted to Wu Youzi for conveyance to the Palace of the Great Perfected Ones at Mount Longhu and the Altar of the Ten Thousand Dharma Sects at Mount Hu, there to be enshrined and worshipped.

No word had been received for some time, but on the eighteenth day of the eighth month, a letter from the Master was delivered via the Perfected One Yi Zhenren. It was learned that the Master had endured long travels and the hardships of the summer heat en route.

Upon reviewing the letter again, it was further understood that the Master had interceded on behalf of a criminal, Chen, seeking clemency for his offenses. This matter is well known to Us. The Master may cultivate harmony in accordance with the seasons to welcome the vital qi.

The great work of expounding the profound mysteries and magnifying the esoteric principles that benefit the state truly aligns with Heaven and safeguards Our imperial enterprise, ensuring its perpetuity through myriad generations.

We, too, revere Heaven with reverence and embody the Dao with virtue, striving to govern with proper teachings.

Moreover, should any places within the palaces and temples of Mount Wudang yield scriptures on the supreme principles, alchemical registers, Dharma texts, or sacred objects, the Master is to diligently seek them out, fulfilling Our sincere devotion to the Dao.

Now, as the envoy returns, this reply is sent. Let the Master take note.

Written on the fourth day after the Mid-Autumn Festival in the fifth year of Jiajing.

On the fourth day of the second month in the seventeenth year of the Jiajing reign under the Great Mandate,

By this edict, the *Zhengyi* Grand Perfected Zhang Yanqing is commanded to proceed to Mount Qiyun for the performance of a jiao offering.

In former years, the Perfected Li Decai was once dispatched to Mount Qiyun to conduct a jiao ritual at the shrine of the Northern Ultimate True Martial Divinity, and the response was indeed efficacious. Now, We specially command you to journey there and reverently perform the fast and jiao rites, both to offer thanks to the deity and to supplicate for the longevity of Our Mother.

Upon completion of the rites, you shall return to your mountain. The eminent scholar Nie Yiran, who accompanies you, is to report back on your journey. All military garrisons, civil authorities, postal relay stations, and other relevant offices along your route shall uniformly provide supplies in accordance with precedent, without delay, obstruction, or disrespect. Should any dare to disregard this edict and repeat their former negligence, you are permitted to report their misconduct in detail for investigation and punishment.

Hence the edict.

Sealed on the nineteenth day of the second month in the seventeenth year of the Jiajing reign under the Great Mandate.

In the eighteenth year, upon petition, Mount Qiyun was granted the same exemptions as Mount Taihe: the official road was removed, and the abbot and administrators were confirmed. The divine palace was named *Xuantian Taisu Gong*. The mountain’s incense tax was also exempted from remittance to the capital, and an edict was issued for its protection.

A handwritten letter of mourning upon the ascension of the Holy Mother:

To the *Xiangyi* Emperor, written and respectfully presented to the residence of the *Zhengyi* Lineage Successor, Perfected Zhang,

I have long accumulated transgressions and have now personally suffered the loss of my compassionate parent on the fourth day of the twelfth month in the *wuxu* year. My five viscera are torn asunder. Moreover, at Nanhua, I personally oversaw the burial site—how could my grief not be redoubled? My mother’s years had not yet reached their full span, and her illnesses lingered for years, day following night, night following day. I had hoped for her recovery, yet how could I have foreseen that the Two Saints would both abandon me? Alas!

I briefly set down my suffering to convey my sorrow. The rest need not be elaborated; I trust you will understand.

Written on an auspicious day in the first month of autumn in the eighteenth year of the Jiajing reign,
Xiangyi bows.

On the fifth day of the fifth month in the nineteenth year of the Jiajing reign, [Imperial Seal]—In the twenty-first year, Imperial Patent Conferring the Title of *Xuanjun* upon the Ladies Zhu and Song.

By the Grace of Heaven and the Mandate of the Emperor, We decree:

The labor of a mother in raising her child is equal to that of instruction, just as a ruler, in relation to his ministers, must fulfill their wish for honor and recognition. When matters pertain to the cultivation of moral influence, how can favor be bound by ordinary measures?

You, Lady Zhu, were the daughter of the late Grand Preceptor and Grand Tutor to the Heir Apparent, the Duke of Chengguo, Yi, and are the lawful mother of Zhang Yanxi, Successor of the Orthodox Unity Teachings, Grand Perfected, and Overseer of Daoist Affairs throughout the empire. From a family of meritorious service, you nurtured refinement; from an official lineage, you spread fragrance. In conduct, you were frugal and diligent; in nature, gentle yet upright. You assisted your husband in attaining the subtleties of the Pure and Subtle, and instructed your son in the sincerity of the Mysterious and Plain. The state relied upon you for blessings, and the Daoist teachings flourished through your virtue. Thus, We extend this noble instruction and bestow upon you an imperial patent, hereby conferring the posthumous title of *Duanrou Shunde Xuanjun* ("Upright, Gentle, Obedient, and Virtuous Mysterious Lady"). May this radiant honor illuminate the Nine Springs, and may your illustrious name endure for a hundred generations.

Decree:

The son’s prosperity is rooted in his mother’s virtue, and the mother’s honor arises from her son’s distinction. In consideration of this minister of the Mysterious Teachings, how could We withhold a command of praise and favor?

You, Lady Song, were the daughter of Qing, Commandant of the Embroidered Uniform Guard, and are the birth mother of Zhang Yantou, Successor of the Orthodox Unity Teachings, Grand Perfected, and Overseer of Daoist Affairs throughout the empire. From a family of eminent officials, your name graced the rolls of the noble. By nature gentle and yielding, you embodied the virtues of frugality and diligence; in bearing, upright and circumspect, you exemplified the winds of purity and tranquility. Weighing your merits, We fittingly grant this honor and bestowal. Hereby, We specially confer upon you the title of *Rouci Chongshan Xuanjun* ("Gentle, Compassionate, Reverent, and Good Mysterious Lady") with this imperial patent. May you, in receiving this exalted grace, forever illuminate the netherworld.

By Imperial Patent.
On the ninth day of the third month in the twenty-first year of the Jiajing reign.

The Forty-Ninth Grand Perfected Zhang Yongxu

In the twenty-eighth year of the Jiajing reign, he was summoned to court alongside his father. Upon reaching the capital gates, the Emperor dispatched the eunuch Gao Zhong to convey imperial consolation and bestow gifts: a ceremonial robe and a jade belt, which he was commanded to wear. The following day, he was received in audience within the inner palace, where a banquet was held in the side hall. He was permitted to inherit the teachings and succeed to the title, though temporarily exempted from court attendance.

*Imperial Edict*
The Emperor decrees:
The Grand Perfected and Successor of the Orthodox Unity Teachings, Zhang Yongxu, was due to attend court in the twenty-ninth year of Jiajing, as per the customary audience cycle. Considering his youth, We specially dispatched the military officer Wang Xun to deliver this edict, exempting him from the present audience. You shall heed Our profound intent and act in accordance with this decree.

*Edict*
*Mandate*
Dated the twenty-fourth day of the seventh month in the twenty-eighth year of Jiajing.

*Imperial Patent of Appointment for the Grand Perfected*
By the grace of Heaven and the mandate of the Emperor, We proclaim:
The sagely transformation is manifestly aided by the teachings of the Mystic Origin; the governance of the realm is silently assisted by the winds of purity and quiescence. As the successor is able to inherit the true transmission, so the court ought to renew its conferral of mandate.

Your ancestor, Zhang Yongxu, in the era of the Flaming Han, propagated the Mystic Mechanism. Through successive generations, he was revered as a teacher and model. When Our imperial ancestor ascended the throne, in recognition of his meritorious prayers and protections for the state, he was granted the hereditary title of Grand Perfected.

You, endowed with intelligence and born with clarity, have upheld the ancestral legacy and inherited the forebears’ blessings. Thus, We now confer upon you the title of Grand Perfected of Orthodox Unity, Successor of the Teachings, Guardian of the Mysteries, Cultivator of Simplicity, Exemplar of the Dao, and Overseer of Daoist Affairs Under Heaven, along with this patent of appointment.

You shall ever more diligently uphold and guard these duties, redoubling your devotion to cultivation. Strive to ensure the flourishing of governance and the prosperity of the people, to secure peace and abundance for the populace. Thus shall the Mystic Blessing be made manifest, and the imperial realm be eternally preserved. Respect this decree.

On the sixteenth day of the fourth month in the twenty-ninth year of the Jiajing reign, the imperial seal was affixed. In this year, an edict was issued to betroth the daughter of Dingguo Duke Xu Yande as his consort. Chengguo Duke Zhu Zhizhong and Sui’an Earl Chen Lian were commanded to deliberate and perform the marriage rites.

In the thirty-first year, he was summoned to court and granted an imperial banquet in the inner palace. A decree was issued through the Directorate of Ceremonial, transmitted by Eunuch Huang Jin: "The Grand Perfected of Orthodox Unity, Successor of the Teachings, Zhang Yongxu, shall be bestowed with the ceremonial robes of an Earl for court audiences and sacrifices, along with their regular use. Respect this decree." The Ministry of Rites, in compliance, memorialized the throne and directed the Ministry of Works to craft the following: one set of red silk court robes, a complete set of red silk court attire with jade and leather belt, a full set of blue silk sacrificial robes, one crimson *fensi* robe, one blue *fensi* robe, one gold crown, one jade belt, and one ivory tablet, to be delivered for his use.

In the first month of the thirty-second year, by imperial grace, the marriage was solemnized. After a month, an official was dispatched to escort him back to his residence. An edict was issued: "Though the Grand Perfected Zhang has prior precedents for his return, this time, by special decree, an official has been sent to accompany him back. Why have provisions been reduced by more than half? Let the previous standard be restored, with an additional quarter granted. No delays or disobedience shall be tolerated. The relevant ministry is to take note."

In this year, the throne disbursed a quantity of silver ingots from the imperial treasury, specially dispatching Zhao Hu, a *Qianhu* of the Embroidered Uniform Guard, to fund the reconstruction of the Zhengyi, Jingying, and Xiangfu Abbeys.

In the thirty-seventh year, an imperial gift of a sacred statue from Xiangshan was bestowed, to be enshrined and worshipped at the Altar of the Ten Thousand Dharma Methods. Approval was granted to confer the register of the Dao upon the Daoist Jin Yuanqing, appointing him as Left Administrator of Orthodox Unity and filling the vacancy of *Tidian* at the Primordial Palace of Purple Heaven on Mount Qiyun. The Dharma Master Zhang Gongji and Qiu Yucai were authorized to serve as *Tidian* and *Tiju* of the Great Upper Clarity Abbey.

On the thirteenth day of the first month in the thirty-eighth year, he was commanded to return home early.

By Our Imperial Edict, a Proclamation to Tranquil Harmony Yuanjun Lady Xu:

The court holds in the highest esteem the teachings of the Supreme Dao, having already propagated its orthodox transformation to seek blessings for the state and the people. It must therefore safeguard its descendants, that they may flourish and perpetuate their lineage. Now that the Grand Perfected One has passed and his son is yet young, We are deeply moved with compassion. We hereby specially confer upon you, Lady Xu, the title of Tranquil Harmony Yuanjun, entrusting you with the governance of internal affairs. Furthermore, We have selected four virtuous and prudent Daoist priests to serve as Assistants in Teaching and Scribes, aiding in the management of external matters.

You must devote particular care to the upbringing of your young son, nurturing and instructing him in due time, that he may not deviate from his inherited path and thus worthily uphold the grace of the state. All members of the clan and household who, relying on their seniority, numerical strength, or high standing, dare to bully, insult, or harm you—should the offense be minor, you may dispatch messengers to report it to the provincial and prefectural authorities for admonishment and disposition; should it be grave, you may submit a detailed memorial to Us for the apprehension and interrogation of the Assistants in Teaching and Scribes. Should any of them act unlawfully, you may likewise restrain and discipline them as described above.

The imperial decree read: "The memorial and all matters concerning posthumous honors and consolation shall be reviewed by the Ministry of Rites in accordance with precedent. Respect this."

**Edict for the Seven Altars of Sacrificial Rites**
On a certain day in the forty-fourth year of the Jiajing reign, the Emperor dispatched Envoy Yao Guangzhu of the Bureau of Ceremonial Commissioners to convey sacrificial rites to the Grand Perfected Zhang Yongxu, saying: "You inherited the leadership of the Daoist teachings and prayed for the state’s blessings. Yet before reaching the prime of life, you were suddenly taken by fate. In grace and consolation, We continue to nurture your orphaned heir. This edict of sacrifice is specially bestowed, and your burial site shall be prepared. May your spirit, if not yet departed, receive this decree with reverence."

**Edict for the First Seventh-Day Rite**
"It was you who inherited the teachings and prayed for blessings, yet you departed this world so soon. Now, on this first seventh-day, We bestow this sacrificial edict once more. If you are aware, receive it with gratitude."

**Edicts for the Hundredth Day, Burial, First Anniversary, and Second Anniversary, with Purification Rites**
"Though you have passed, time has swiftly advanced. Now, on this appointed day, We dispatch these sacrificial rites. May your spirit, if not yet extinguished, partake of this profound grace."

**Imperial Proclamation**
"The transmission of the Dao follows its lineage; the teachings flourish from the Primordial Beginning. Humanity is rooted in its ancestors, and rites of reverence are weighty in their veneration. You, Zhang Yandai, grandfather of Zhang Guoxiang, Grand Perfected of the Orthodox Unity Tradition, who upheld sincerity in the Dao, expounded the mysteries, and propagated the teachings, emerged from the Mystic Gate and wandered beyond the mundane. Within your numinous abode, you nurtured true virtue, and your grandson now carries forth the ancestral legacy, silently aiding in the transformation of governance. In response to your grandson’s petition, We posthumously confer upon you the title of Grand Perfected of the Orthodox Unity Tradition, who upheld sincerity and revered the model, that you may partake of the imperial favor and spread your illustrious radiance in the records of immortals."

**Proclamation**
"The origin of the Daoist teachings lies in the Mystic Female; the prosperity of a grandson’s legacy begins in the inner chambers. You, Lady Yang, grandmother of Zhang Guoxiang, Grand Perfected of the Orthodox Unity Tradition, who upheld sincerity in the Dao, expounded the mysteries, and propagated the teachings, were a woman of refined virtue from a noble family, wed to a descendant of immortals. Through two generations, you fostered auspicious omens and grandly continued the true lineage. We posthumously confer upon you the title of Serene and Virtuous Mystic Lady, that you may reverently receive the imperial decree and perpetuate your numinous legacy."

**Imperial Patent**

We reflect that in the governance of emperors and kings, all prayers for blessings, the presentation of sacred mysteries, the bestowal of fortune, and the guidance of the people—whereby the subtle workings of transformation and governance are harmonized—are invariably esteemed through the Daoist teachings. By precedent, you are thus fitting to receive Our favor and commendation. We now specially enfeoff you as Grand Perfected of the Orthodox Unity Tradition, who upholds sincerity in the Dao, expounds the mysteries, propagates the teachings, and oversees all Daoist affairs under Heaven, and bestow upon you this patent of enfeoffment. May you diligently cultivate and strengthen your resolve, fortify your practice, propagate the true wind to perfect your lineage, and manifest the profound transformation through generations, thereby aiding the fortunes of the realm and justifying this exalted honor. Reverently receive this decree.

Decree:

The Daoist teachings illuminate the norms of human relations, and their shared glory is commensurate with enduring canons. When those of noble lineage and imperial consorts emulate the excellence of the Mystic Gate, their virtue is all the more worthy of praise. The wife of Zhang Guoxiang, Grand Perfected of the Orthodox Unity Tradition, who upholds sincerity in the Dao, expounds the mysteries, propagates the teachings, and oversees all Daoist affairs under Heaven, Lady Xie, is the daughter of the former Minister of the Court of the Imperial Clan, Grand Guardian of the Heir Apparent, and Commandery Prince Consort of the Imperial Carriage, Xie Shao. She descends from the sister of Emperor Yi, and belongs to the lineage of the imperial consorts. She has cast aside worldly splendor, embracing simplicity, served her mother-in-law with filial devotion, and cultivated purity in her conduct. We now bestow upon her this patent, enfeoffing her as the Serene and Chaste Mystic Lady. Reverently receive this decree.

**Imperial Patent**
